newsitem.title: USA: TCF Financial to buy Standard Financial - WSJ.
newsitem.headline: TCF Financial to buy Standard Financial - WSJ.

text.p: TCF Financial said it reached a definitive agreement to buy Standard Financial Inc for cash and stock valued at about $424 million, the Wall Street Journal reported in its electronic edition Monday.
Minneapolis-based TCF said it would pay about $25 per share, with Standard shareholders having a choice of cash, stock or a combination of both, the paper said.
Standard Financial is based in Chicago.
TCF Financial said the acquisitions would produce long-term revenue benefits and cost savings, the paper said.
The acquisition was expected to close in the third quarter, the paper said.
TCF Financial said Standard agreed to pay a $15 million fee if the deal was terminated, the paper said.
